nodes.bodyText: Even if this Material didn't change between versions, it might be better to have a constant with Aliases.javaItemtype("iron sword") and use ItemType#getMaterial here, just to avoid referencing the enum in general.
Good idea... never know what is going to happen in the future.
I think this could be a private final static constant for the class

If it were, id have to clone it each time its used. In that case its the same as creating a new item stack.
Unless I were to make a final private static ItemType then use getRandom within this method.
Thoughts?
https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript/blob/master/src/main/java/ch/njol/skript/expressions/ExprSkull.java I'm not sure, but other components of Skript do it like that
Cloning might be marginally cheaper than constructing the ItemType again, not that it really matters on this case though.
Im going to leave it as is. As snow said it won't really matter here.
